snippet: The embattled Syrian city of Homs remained under siege for a sixth day Thursday with residents throughout the city cowering in their homes and medical supplies dwindling.
abstract: Embattled Syrian city of Homs remains under siege for a sixth day with tank shells ripping into contested neighborhoods, residents cowering at home and medical supplies rapidly dwindling; city remains largely sealed off by the Syrian military, with death tolls estimated to be more than 50 people.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Beirut, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: The embattled Syrian city of Homs remained under siege for a sixth day Thursday with residents throughout the city cowering in their homes and medical supplies dwindling.

headline.seo: Dozens More Die in Syrian Violence, Activists Say
headline.main: Dozens More Die in Syrian Violence, Activists Say
headline.print_headline: Siege Paralyzes Syrian City as Shelling and Toll Mount
